result.execSummary:
All charges against Denarious Antonio Stanley in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Denarious Antonio Stanley is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Motion & Order to Dismiss without prejudice

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denarious Antonio Stanley

defendant.name: Stanley, Denarious Antonio
defendant.address: 617 Walden Court Apt A, Altoona, WI 54720

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:45 PM Attorney Francis Rivard appeared by video means with Defendant Denarious Antonio Stanley appeared by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Stanley has not made contact with the PD office yet and Mr. Rivard has representated him previously on another matter.  Defendant has no questions regarding his charges or rights.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Denarious Antonio Stanley
Current: 617 Walden Court Apt A, Altoona, WI 54720 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 425 Hobart Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703

01:36 PM Defendant Denarious Antonio Stanley appeared by video means from the Pepin County Jail. 19CF24 and 22CM05.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Stanley turned himself in last week to begin serving his sentence in 19CF24 and sentence will be completed as of today.  He also has unpaid obligations.  In 22CM05 Mr. Rivard enters NGP and request return date 30 - 60 days out.  NGP entered.  Mr. Rivard agrees to conduct the hearing by zoom.  In 19CF34 Court puts you back on a payment plan of $100/mo. com. 6/1.  Defendant agrees.  When he's done serving the 19CF34, he can be released unless something else holding him.  There is a cash bond on the new case Mr. Rivard wishes to address.  22CM05 bond required for FTA to serve the sentence, he was sentenced in September and ordered to report no later than 11/13.  Mr. Stanley attempted to obtain employment during that time.  Mr. Stanley suffered some difficulties and placed in Mendota in mid December until 12/23.  Got out and was not his normal self and set up with a doctor and on medications that were not very effective and as soon as he was able to comprehend, he called the jail and came in voluntarily.  He cannot afford the $500 cash bail and ask the court consider a signature bond on that matter.  He's been a resident of the area all of his adult life as well as his family in Altoona.  He has transportation.  Ask the court to consider signature bond.  Mr. Seifert with that explanation has no objection to signature bond.  Court will let you out of jail.  Cash bond amended to $500 signature bond.  Conditions:  no entrance of bars or taverns; no possession or consumptions of controlled substances without a prescription; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Mailing address:  617 Walden Court Apt A, Altoona, WI  54720.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:45 PM Defendant Denarious Antonio Stanley appeared by video means from the Pepin County Jail wtithout counsel.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge in the criminal complaint alleged as a repeater, max. penalties and advised of rights.  Attorney Seifert addresses this is a failure to report to jail with underlying case 19CF34 and can start serving his jail time.  Given the fact he did not report, request cash bond of $500.  Court informs defendant he will have to now serve the 10 days jail in 19CF34 for conviction for attempt to receive or steal stolen property.  Once that is served, the State want you held on $500 cash bond for the new charge of failure to report.  Given the fact you failed to report for a number of months, impose a $500 cash bond in 22CM05 once you have served your time in the old case.  Court encourages defendant to contact the PD.  There is one other matter in 19CF34 there was court costs of $443.00 which needs to be resolved before you leave the jail.  Court will address that the next time you are in court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
